pullRequest.title: - Removing body struct from our own usage.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Deprecate public methods using body struct.
Update expected generated config.

@vekterli and @arnej27959 PR
This should make it possible to remove all traces on vespa 8. I think deprecation warnings has been adde on relevant places.

commit.message:
- Removing body struct from our own usage.
- Deprecate public methods using body struct.
- Update expected generated config.

nodes.bodyText: Is there a risk that someone might call this today (despite being deprecated) and effectively expect an empty Struct instead of null?
Can this entire iterator facade be removed now?
Same question as getBody wrt. existing callers expecting something here. If there might be, maybe we should have a dummy empty sentinel struct type that gets returned?
Can this iterator facade be removed too?

commit.message: Follow up from PR comments and GC some more code.
